dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Trending tickers: Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix, Adidas and JD Wetherspoon
News Content: Nvidia (NVDA)

Chipmaker Nvidia has overtaken Apple (AAPL) once again to become the world's most valuable company, after the company's shares rose in Tuesday's session.

Nvidia now has a market capitalisation of nearly $3.45tn (£2.79tn), compared to Apple's $3.35tn, with shares in the iPhone maker having fallen 3% in the previous session.

Shares in Nvidia climbed more than 2% on Tuesday and were up 2.5% in pre-market trading on Wednesday.

This came after newly reinstated president Donald Trump announced a new $500bn private sector investment to build artificial infrastructure in the US.

Read more: FTSE 100 LIVE: Stocks rise as UK borrowing jumps unexpectedly

Initial equity funders for the "Stargate Project" are OpenAI, Oracle (ORCL), SoftBank (9984.T) and MGX, while Nvidia is one of the initial technology partners.

Ben Barringer, technology analyst at Quilter Cheviot, said: "This development is undeniably a boon for the AI sector. Companies involved in supplying the technology and infrastructure for Project Stargate are well-positioned to benefit significantly.

"The move underscores the increasing strategic importance of AI innovation, further solidifying its role as a cornerstone of economic and technological advancement. For investors in the AI space, this announcement highlights a wealth of opportunities as the competition to dominate the sector intensifies."

•USD

(NVDA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Oracle (ORCL)

Shares in Oracle jumped 7% on Tuesday and were up 8% in pre-market trading on Wednesday morning, following Trump's announcement.

The stock was also trending after Trump reportedly said at event on Tuesday that he would be open to Oracle chairman Larry Ellison or Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk purchasing social media app TikTok, as part of a joint venture with the US government.

According to a Bloomberg report, Trump said: "I have the right to make a deal."

"So what I’m thinking about saying to somebody is buy it and give half to the United States of America, half, and we’ll give you the permit, and they’ll have a great partner," he added.

Read more: Pound, gold and oil prices in focus: commodity and currency check, 22 January

In one of his early actions after being sworn in for a second presidential term on Monday, Trump signed an executive order to delay the ban of TikTok in the US.

When asked about Trump's proposal that TikTok-owner, Chinese company ByteDance, hand over half of the platform to a US company, China foreign ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said: "TikTok has operated in the US for years and been very popular with American users."

Story Continues

"It has played a positive role in boosting US employment and consumption. We hope the US will earnestly listen to the voice of reason and provide an open, fair, just and non-discriminatory business environment for market entities from all countries."

•USD

(ORCL)

Follow  View Quote Details

Netflix (NFLX)

Shares in Netflix soared 14% in pre-market trading on Wednesday, after the streaming giant reported 18.9 million users in the fourth quarter, with revenue and earnings also beating expectations.

Revenue of $8.83bn for the fourth quarter was up 12.5% year-on-year and diluted earnings per share came in at $2.11 for the final three months of its fiscal year.

The company also announced a $15bn share buyback and raised its full-year revenue outlook to come in between $43.5bn and $44.5bn. That was ahead of its prior range of $43bn to $44bn.

Read more: Stocks that are trending today

Strong subscriber gains came on the back of Netflix ending 2024 with two back-to-back NFL games, a successful "Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson" boxing match, and the return of the highly-popular "Squid Game" series.

Matt Britzman, senior equity analyst at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "Netflix keeps us hooked with fresh content slates, drawing millions of new viewers while keeping existing customers happy at the same time. This is the last quarter Netflix will report net subscriber growth, and it’s blown expectations out of the water.

"While rivals hike prices and wrestle with losses, Netflix is raking in cash and striking deals like WWE and NFL to strengthen its lineup. Competitors selling their best shows to Netflix only make its library stronger, keeping us watching – and, crucially, paying."

•USD

(NFLX)

Follow  View Quote Details

Adidas (ADS.DE)

In Europe, shares in sportswear brand Adidas surged nearly 7% on Wednesday morning, after the company posted stronger-than-expected preliminary fourth quarter results.

Adidas revenues grew 24% to €5.97bn (£5.05tn) in the fourth quarter, while operating profit reached €57m in the quarter, versus an operating loss of €377m.

Stocks: Create your watchlist and portfolio

The jump in the shares helped drive the pan-European STOXX 600 (^STOXX) to an all-time high on Wednesday morning.

Deutsche Bank analysts said in a note on Wednesday that they had a "buy" rating on the stock.

"Our buy case on Adidas is built on increasing brand heat, positive earnings momentum and strong EPS growth," they said. "All of this is evidenced again in 4Q."

•USD

(ADS.DE)

Follow  View Quote Details

JD Wetherspoon (JDW.L)

Shares in UK pub operator JD Wetherspoon dipped nearly 2% into the red on Wednesday, after the company's chairman Tim Martin warned of higher costs.

Martin had already warned that costs at Wetherspoons would increase this year by £60m per annum, on the back of increases in the autumn budget to employer national insurance contributions and the national minimum wage.

Read more: Higher-than-expected UK borrowing heaps pressure on Rachel Reeves

"Government-mandated wage increases have a significantly bigger impact on pub and restaurant companies than supermarkets," Martin said.

Derren Nathan, head of equity research at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "There’s no more vociferous campaigner for landlord rights than chairman Tim Martin who has pointed out that volumes of pub’s biggest product line, beer, have collapsed by 52% between 2000 and 2023.

"Average on-trade prices are now at £4.98 per pint and far more sensitive to labour cost increases than supermarket equivalents, where you can pick up 568 ml of refreshment for an average price of £1.20."

In the trading update, JD Wetherspoon reported 5.1% growth in like-for-like sales.

•USD

(JDW.L)

Follow  View Quote Details

Other companies in the news on Wednesday 22 January:

Arm Holdings (ARM)

Apple (AAPL)

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's strong admiration for Apple and the loyalty of iPhone users, which could positively influence investor sentiment. However, it also mentions significant challenges Apple is facing, particularly in the Chinese market, where sales have dropped and competition is increasing. Additionally, Buffett's recent reduction of his stake in Apple may raise concerns among investors. Overall, while the loyalty and brand strength are positive factors, the challenges and Buffett's actions suggest a mixed outlook. Therefore, the probabilities reflect a slightly higher chance of a price rise due to brand loyalty but also a notable chance of a price fall due to market challenges.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article presents a mixed picture for Apple. On one hand, it highlights Warren Buffett's long-standing admiration for Apple and the strong brand loyalty associated with iPhones. This positive sentiment could support the stock price. However, the article also points out significant challenges, including a 17% drop in iPhone sales in China and increased competition from local brands. Furthermore, Berkshire Hathaway's recent reduction of its Apple stake by 25% raises concerns about Buffett's evolving strategy and potential market downturn anticipation. The negative aspects seem to outweigh the positive, suggesting a higher probability of a stock price fall. The Buffett quote is old news and already priced in. The China sales drop and stake reduction are more recent and impactful.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed picture for Apple's stock. While the company's earnings projections are positive, showing growth in EPS and revenue,  the stock's recent underperformance compared to the market and sector is concerning.  The Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) is neutral, and the high Forward P/E and PEG ratios suggest the stock is trading at a premium compared to its industry peers.  The positive aspect is the strong Zacks Industry Rank for the Computer - Micro Computers industry, suggesting sector strength. However, the lack of recent changes in analyst estimates and the relatively small daily gain lagging the market indices weigh against a significant price increase. Considering these factors, a moderate probability of a price rise is assigned, with a higher probability of a relatively flat or slightly negative movement.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news indicates that Samsung is launching an ultrathin version of its Galaxy S25 phone, potentially beating Apple to market in this category. While Apple is also expected to release a similar product later in the year, the immediate competitive pressure from Samsung could negatively impact investor sentiment towards Apple in the short term. However, Apple's strong brand loyalty and historical performance in product launches may mitigate some of the negative impact. The probability of a stock price fall is slightly higher due to the competitive threat, but the overall impact is likely moderate given Apple's broader product ecosystem and market position.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Missing probability_of_stock_price_rise
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article discusses Nvidia overtaking Apple as the world's most valuable company, with Nvidia's market capitalization reaching nearly $3.45tn and Apple's at $3.35tn. This change in market capitalization is largely due to Nvidia's shares rising and Apple's shares falling. The article also mentions various other companies and their stock performances but focuses on the shift between Nvidia and Apple. Given this context, the probability of Apple's stock price rising is lower because the news indicates a decline in Apple's shares, while Nvidia's shares are on the rise.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Samsung's new Galaxy S25 line with a strong emphasis on AI features. This could potentially draw attention to competition in the smartphone market, specifically in AI capabilities. However, Apple is known for its innovative features and strong brand loyalty. The news might not immediately affect Apple's stock directly, as Apple's competitive advantage lies in its ecosystem and software rather than just hardware features. However, concerns about iPhone sales due to potential competition could have a minor negative impact on investor sentiment.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news article discusses Nvidia overtaking Apple as the world's most valuable company, with Nvidia's market capitalization reaching nearly $3.45tn and Apple's at $3.35tn. This change is largely due to Nvidia's shares rising and Apple's shares falling. Additionally, there are mentions of various other companies and their stock performances but no direct positive news about Apple. Given this context, the probability of Apple's stock price rising seems lower due to the comparative performance and market dynamics.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Nvidia overtakes Apple as world's most valuable company",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.35,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.65
}
```
